p.s: In the given excerpt our of the novel The Great Gatsby written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925, Daisy and Gatsby meet for the first time after almost five years.
The excerpt starts when Daisy arrives at Nick's house.
He invited her and Gatsby without her knowing that she'll be meeting Gatsby.
When they enter the house Nick is surprised because Gatsby is not in the living room anymore but shortly after there is a knock on the door and Gatsby stands outside.
As Nick opens the door he sees him standing in the rain, pale white and extremlyextremely nervous.
Gatsby stares at Nick for a moment but then passes him and enters the living room where Daisy is.
Firstly, there is an akwardawkward silence, both Daisy and Gatsby do not talk very much and Nick also feels affected by the akwardnessawkwardness.
He trystries to prevent any longer silence but both Daisy and Gatsby are unsure and especially Gatsby seems like he doesn't want to be there.
When Nick trystries to leave, Gatsby pulls him outside the room and regrets his actions and the general plan.
Nick tells him that Daisy and him both feel embarrassed and that Gatsby should stop being rude and instead talk to her.
When Gatsby enters again Nick leaves the house and stares at Gatsby's from his garden.
He admires the colossal mansion and tells the reader a little bit about it'sits origin.
After half an hour, Nick reenters and sees Daisy and Gatsby sitting across each other.
There is no embarressementembarrassment anymore but a change in both of them.
Daisy is crying and Gatsby not at all nervous anymore, seems happy and excited.
The excerpt ends with him inviting Daisy and Nick over to his house so he can show Daisy what he owns.
